channel.title: Calculate steepest gradient of sine graph
channel.description:
Okay I have a sine graph with actual values on the x and y axis.
Is there a fairly simple mathematical way to calculate the steepest gradient of the graph, or can it only be done by drawing a gradient triangle?

item.title: Calculate steepest gradient of sine graph
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

nvm someone at school showed me how to do it

ps heres my super awesome non-calculus method of finding the gradient (did it in php coz my calculator was annoying me):

  $amplitude = 10;
  $period = 8;
  $lowerAngle = 0;
  $upperAngle = 0.0001;
  $gradient = (($amplitude*sin(deg2rad($upperAngle)))-($amplitude*sin(deg2rad($lowerAngle))))/((($period/360)*$upperAngle)-(($period/360)*$lowerAngle));
  echo 'Gradient: '.$gradient;
